title: Intensive Short-Term Course on Implementing Universal Design for Learning (UDL) Through Co-Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic instructional design concepts and project-based learning experience
context.additional_context: Hands-on opportunities for applying the UDL framework while addressing learner diversity, with collaborative and resource-creation environments using personal devices

learning_goals: Learners can apply the three UDL (Universal Design for Learning) principles—engagement, representation, action & expression—to actual project designs through collaborative design processes
Learners can develop at least two personalized instructional strategies based on learner variability analysis
Learners can revise PBL (Project-Based Learning) activity designs at least once by incorporating peer feedback
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
